    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Foverview.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Foverview.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,74 @@\n+---\n+title: What's Microsoft Entra Permissions Management?\n+description: An introduction to Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: overview\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# What's Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+Microsoft Entra Permissions Management is a cloud infrastructure entitlement management (CIEM) solution that provides comprehensive visibility into permissions assigned to all identities. For example, over-privileged workload and user identities, actions, and resources across multicloud infrastructures in Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).\n+\n+Permissions Management  detects, automatically right-sizes, and continuously monitors unused and excessive permissions.\n+\n+Organizations have to consider permissions management as a central piece of their Zero Trust security to implement least privilege access across their entire infrastructure:\n+\n+- Organizations are increasingly adopting multicloud strategy and are struggling with the lack of visibility and the increasing complexity of managing access permissions.\n+- With the growth of identities and cloud services, the number of high-risk cloud permissions is exploding, expanding the attack surface for organizations.\n+- IT security teams are under increased pressure to ensure access to their expanding cloud estate is secure and compliant.\n+- The inconsistency of cloud providers' native access management models makes it even more complex for Security and Identity to manage permissions and enforce least privilege access policies across their entire environment.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/overview/key-use-cases.png\" alt-text=\"Diagram of Microsoft Entra Permissions Management use cases.\" lightbox=\"media/overview/key-use-cases.png\":::\n+\n+## Key use cases\n+\n+Permissions Management allows customers to address three key use cases: *discover*, *remediate*, and *monitor*.\n+\n+Permissions Management is designed in such a way that we recommended you 'step-through' each of the below phases in order to gain insights into permissions across the organization. This is because you generally can't take action on what has not been discovered, likewise you can't continually evaluate what has not been remediated.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/overview/discover-remediate-monitor.png\" alt-text=\"Permissions Management use case diagram showing the discover, remediate, and monitor phases.\":::\n+\n+### Discover\n+\n+Customers can assess permission risks by evaluating the gap between permissions granted and permissions used.\n+\n+- Cross-cloud permissions discovery: Granular and normalized metrics for key cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, and GCP.\n+- Permission Creep Index (PCI): An aggregated metric that periodically evaluates the level of risk associated with the number of unused or excessive permissions across your identities and resources. It measures how much damage identities can cause based on the permissions they have.\n+- Permission usage analytics: Multi-dimensional view of permissions risk for all identities, actions, and resources.\n+\n+### Remediate\n+\n+Customers can right-size permissions based on usage, grant new permissions on-demand, and automate just-in-time access for cloud resources.\n+\n+- Automated deletion of permissions unused for the past 90 days.\n+- Permissions on-demand: Grant identities permissions on-demand for a time-limited period or an as-needed basis.\n+\n+\n+### Monitor\n+\n+Customers can detect anomalous activities with machine learning-powered (ML-powered) alerts and generate detailed forensic reports.\n+\n+- ML-powered anomaly detections.\n+- Context-rich forensic reports around identities, actions, and resources to support rapid investigation and remediation.\n+\n+Permissions Management deepens Zero Trust security strategies by augmenting the least privilege access principle, allowing customers to:\n+\n+- Get comprehensive visibility: Discover which identity is doing what, where, and when.\n+- Automate least privilege access: Use access analytics to ensure identities have the right permissions, at the right time.\n+- Unify access policies across infrastructure as a service (IaaS) platforms: Implement consistent security policies across your cloud infrastructure.\n+\n+Once your organization has explored and implemented the discover, remediation and monitor phases, you've established one of the core pillars of a modern zero-trust security strategy.\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- Deepen your learning with [Introduction to Microsoft Entra Permissions Management](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2240016) learn module. \n+- Sign up for a [45-day free trial](https://aka.ms/TryPermissionsManagement) of Permissions Management.\n+- For a list of frequently asked questions (FAQs) about Permissions Management, see [FAQs](faqs.md)."
  },

    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@\n+---\n+title:  Microsoft Entra Permissions Management partners\n+description: View current Microsoft Entra Permissions Management partners and their websites.\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: reference\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# Microsoft Entra Permissions Management partners\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+Microsoft verified partners can help you onboard Microsoft Entra Permissions Management (Permissions Management) and run a risk assessment across your entire multicloud environment.\n+\n+## Benefits of working with Microsoft verified partners\n+\n+* **Product Expertise**\n+\n+    Our partners help you navigate Permissions Management, letting you in on best practices and guidance to enhance your security strategy.\n+\n+* **Risk Assessment**\n+\n+    Partners guide you through the Microsoft Entra Permissions Management risk assessment and help you identify top permission risks across your multicloud infrastructure.\n+\n+* **Onboarding and Deployment Support**\n+\n+    Partners can guide you through the entire onboarding and deployment process for Permissions Management across AWS, Azure, and GCP.\n+\n+\n+## Partner list\n+\n+Select a partner from the list provided to begin your Permissions Management risk assessment. Additionally, Microsoft provides a [full list of security partners](https://www.microsoft.com/security/business/find-a-partner) that can help secure your organization.\n+\n+If you're a partner and would like to be considered for the Microsoft Entra Permissions Management partner list, submit a     "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fpermissions-management-for-defender-for-cloud.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fpermissions-management-for-defender-for-cloud.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fpermissions-management-for-defender-for-cloud.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@\n+---\n+title: Microsoft Entra Permissions Management integrates with Microsoft Defender for Cloud\n+description: Learn how Microsoft Entra Permissions Management helps strengthen security in cloud environments as an enhancement for Defender for Cloud\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: article\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# Microsoft Entra Permissions Management integration with Microsoft Defender for Cloud\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) is a security model that helps organizations manage and control user access and entitlements in their cloud infrastructure. CIEM is a critical component of a Cloud Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP) solution providing visibility into who has access to what resources and ensuring access rights align with the principle of least privilege (PoLP), where users have the minimum levels of access necessary to perform their tasks.  \n+ \n+Microsoft delivers both CNAPP and CIEM solutions with Microsoft Defender for Cloud (CNAPP) and Microsoft Entra Permissions Management (CIEM). While both Defender for Cloud and Permissions Management help secure customers’ cloud environments, they're two distinct security solutions that address different aspects of cloud security. Permissions Management focuses on managing and enforcing fine-grained access controls, permissions, and entitlements for identities across multicloud infrastructures. Defender for Cloud focuses on securing cloud-native applications such as containers, microservices, and serverless applications through visibility into application behavior and security posture.  \n+\n+## How Permissions Management works with Defender for Cloud\n+\n+Permissions Management capabilities are available to integrate into the Defender for Cloud CSPM plan. Adding the capabilities of Permissions Management to Defender for Cloud strengthens the prevention of security breaches that might occur due to excessive permissions or misconfigurations in the cloud environment. By continuously monitoring and managing cloud entitlements, Permissions Management helps to reduce the attack surface, detect potential threats, and maintain compliance with regulatory standards. These added features make Permissions Management an essential tool to integrate into the capabilities of Defender for Cloud for securing cloud-native applications and protecting sensitive data in the cloud. \n+\n+\n+## Permissions Management and Defender for Cloud capabilities\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/permissions-management-for-defender-for-cloud/permissions-management-defender-for-cloud-comparison.png\" alt-text=\"A table showing the difference in capabilities of Permissions Management and Defender for Cloud.\" lightbox=\"media/permissions-management-for-defender-for-cloud/permissions-management-defender-for-cloud-comparison.png\":::\n+\n+\n+\n+## Common use cases and scenarios\n+\n+With the added capabilities of Permissions Management, you can track permissions analytics, unused permissions for active identities, and over-permissioned identities then act to mitigate them to support the best practice of least privilege in Defender for Cloud. \n+\n+\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- For instructions on how to enable Permissions Management in your Defender for Cloud environment, see [Enable Permissions Management in Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2252561)."
  },

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fpermissions-management-quickstart-guide.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fpermissions-management-quickstart-guide.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,196 @@\n+---\n+title: Microsoft Entra Permissions Management Quickstart Guide\n+description: Quickstart guide - How to quickly onboard your Microsoft Entra Permissions Management product\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+ms.topic: quickstart\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n+# CustomerIntent: As a security administrator, I want to successfully onboard Permissions Management so that I can enable identity security in my cloud environment as efficiently as possible.'\n+---\n+\n+# Quickstart guide to Microsoft Entra Permissions Management \n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+Welcome to the Quickstart Guide for Microsoft Entra Permissions Management. \n+\n+Permissions Management is a Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) solution that provides comprehensive visibility into permissions assigned to all identities. These identities include over-privileged workload and user identities, actions, and resources across multicloud infrastructures in Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Permissions Management helps your organization effectively secure and manage cloud permissions by detecting, automatically right-sizing, and continuously monitoring unused and excessive permissions. \n+\n+With this quickstart guide, you’ll set up your multicloud environment(s), configure data collection, and enable permissions access to ensure your cloud identities are managed and secure.  \n+\n+## Prerequisites \n+\n+Before you begin, you need access to these tools for the onboarding process: \n+\n+- Access to a local BASH shell with the Azure CLI or Azure Cloud Shell using BASH environment (Azure CLI is included). \n+- Access to AWS, Azure, and GCP consoles.\n+- A user must have the [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator) role assignment to create a new app registration in Microsoft Entra tenant is required for AWS and GCP onboarding. \n+\n+\n+## Step 1: Set-up Permissions Management\n+\n+To enable Permissions Management, you must have a Microsoft Entra tenant (example, Microsoft Entra admin center).  \n+- If you have an Azure account, you automatically have a Microsoft Entra admin center tenant. \n+- If you don’t already have one, create a free account at [entra.microsoft.com.](https://entra.microsoft.com)\n+\n+If the above points are met, continue with:\n+\n+[Enable Microsoft Entra Permissions Management in your organization](onboard-enable-tenant.md)\n+\n+Ensure you're a [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator). Learn more about [Permissions Management roles and permissions](product-roles-permissions.md). \n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/entra-id-roles-sync-azure-environment.png\" alt-text=\"A diagram showing where Microsoft Entra intersect with Azure roles in the Microsoft Entra tenant.\" lightbox=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/entra-id-roles-sync-azure-environment.png\":::\n+ \n+## Step 2: Onboard your multicloud environment\n+\n+So far you’ve,  \n+\n+1. Been assigned the *Permissions Management Administrator* role in your Microsoft Entra admin center tenant. \n+2. Purchased licenses or activated your 45-day free trial for Permissions Management. \n+3. Successfully launched Permissions Management.\n+\n+Now, you're going to learn about the role and settings of the Controller and Data collection modes in Permissions Management.\n+\n+### Set the controller \n+The controller gives you the choice to determine the level of access you grant to users in Permissions Management.  \n+\n+- Enabling the controller during onboarding grants Permissions Management admin access, or read and write access, so users can right-size permissions and remediate directly through Permissions Management (instead of going to the AWS, Azure, or GCP consoles).  \n+\n+- Disabling the controller during onboarding, or never enabling it, grants a Permissions Management user read-only access to your environment(s).  \n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> If you don't enable the controller during onboarding, you have the option to enable it after onboarding is complete. To set the controller in Permissions Management after onboarding, see [Enable or disable the controller after onboarding](onboard-enable-controller-after-onboarding.md).\n+> For AWS environments, once you have enabled the controller, you *cannot* disable it. \n+\n+To set the controller settings during onboarding:\n+1. Select **Enable** to give read and write access to Permissions Management.\n+2. Select **Disable** to give read-only access to Permissions Management.\n+\n+### Configure data collection\n+\n+There are three modes to choose from in order to collect data in Permissions Management. \n+\n+- **Automatic (recommended)** \n+Permissions Management automatically discovers, onboards, and monitors all current and future subscriptions. \n+\n+- **Manual** \n+Manually enter individual subscriptions for Permissions Management to discover, onboard, and monitor. You can enter up to 100 subscriptions per data collection.  \n+\n+- **Select** \n+Permissions Management automatically discovers all current subscriptions. Once discovered, you select which subscriptions to onboard and monitor. \n+\n+> [!NOTE] \n+> To use **Automatic** or **Select** modes, the controller must be enabled while configuring data collection. \n+\n+To configure data collection:\n+1. In Permissions Management, go to the **Data Collectors** page.\n+2. Select a cloud environment: **AWS**, **Azure**, or **GCP**.\n+3. Click **Create configuration**.\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> The data collection process takes some time and occurs in approximately 4-5 hour intervals in most cases. The time frame depends on the size of the authorization system you have and how much data is available for collection.\n+\n+\n+### Onboard Amazon Web Services (AWS)\n+Since Permissions Management is hosted on Microsoft Entra, there are more steps to take to onboard your AWS environment.  \n+\n+To connect AWS to Permissions Management, you must create a Microsoft Entra application in the Microsoft Entra admin center tenant where Permissions Management is enabled. This Microsoft Entra application is used to set up an OIDC connection to your AWS environment.\n+\n+*OpenID Connect (OIDC) is an interoperable authentication protocol based on the OAuth 2.0 family of specifications.*\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/entra-id-tenant-amazon-web-service-connection.png\" alt-text=\"A diagram showing the connection between Microsoft Entra ID and an AWS cloud environment.\" lightbox=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/entra-id-tenant-amazon-web-service-connection.png\":::\n+\n+\n+### Prerequisites \n+\n+A user must have the [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator) role assignment to create a new app registration in Microsoft Entra ID. \n+\n+Account IDs and roles for: \n+- AWS OIDC account: An AWS member account designated by you to create and host the OIDC connection through an OIDC IdP\n+- AWS Logging account (optional but recommended) \n+- AWS Management account (optional but recommended)  \n+- AWS member accounts monitored and managed by Permissions Management (for manual mode) \n+\n+To use **Automatic** or **Select** data collection modes, you must connect your AWS Management account.  \n+\n+During this step, you can enable the controller by entering the name of the S3 bucket with AWS CloudTrail activity logs (found on AWS Trails). \n+\n+To onboard your AWS environment and configure data collection, see [Onboard an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account](onboard-aws.md).\n+\n+### Onboard Microsoft Azure\n+When you enabled Permissions Management in the Microsoft Entra tenant, an enterprise application for CIEM was created. To onboard your Azure environment, you grant permissions to this application for Permissions management.\n+\n+1. In the Microsoft Entra tenant where Permissions management is enabled, locate the **Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM)** enterprise application.  \n+\n+2. Assign the *Reader* role to the CIEM application to allow Permissions management to read the Microsoft Entra subscriptions in your environment. \n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/entra-id-tenant-role-connection-azure-subscriptions.png\" alt-text=\"A diagram showing the connection between the Microsoft Entra role connections to an Azure subscription.\" lightbox=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/entra-id-tenant-role-connection-azure-subscriptions.png\":::\n+\n+### Prerequisites \n+- A user with ```Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/write``` permissions at the subscription or management group scope to assign roles to the CIEM application.\n+\n+- To use **Automatic** or **Select** data collection modes, you must assign the *Reader* role at the Management group scope. \n+\n+- To enable the controller, you must assign the *User Access Administrator* role to the CIEM application. \n+\n+To onboard your Azure environment and configure data collection, see [Onboard a Microsoft Azure subscription](onboard-azure.md).\n+\n+\n+### Onboard Google Cloud Platform (GCP)\n+Because Permissions Management is hosted on Microsoft Azure, there are additional steps to take to onboard your GCP environment.\n+\n+To connect GCP to Permissions Management, you must create a Microsoft Entra admin center application in the Microsoft Entra tenant where Permissions Management is enabled. This Microsoft Entra admin center application is used to set up an OIDC connection to your GCP environment.   \n+\n+*OpenID Connect (OIDC) is an interoperable authentication protocol based on the OAuth 2.0 family of specifications.* \n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/google-cloud-platform-oidc-application.png\" alt-text=\"A diagram showing the connection between the Microsoft Entra OIDC application and a GCP cloud environment.\" lightbox=\"media/permissions-management-quickstart-guide/google-cloud-platform-oidc-application.png\":::\n+\n+### Prerequisites \n+A user with the ability to create a new app registration in Microsoft Entra (needed to facilitate the OIDC connection) is needed for AWS and GCP onboarding. \n+ \n+ID details for: \n+- GCP OIDC project: a GCP project designated by you to create and host the OIDC connection through an OIDC IdP. \n+    - Project number and project ID \n+- GCP OIDC Workload identity \n+    - Pool ID, pool provider ID \n+- GCP OIDC service account \n+    - G-suite IdP Secret name and G-suite IdP user email (optional) \n+    - IDs for the GCP projects you wish to onboard (optional, for manual mode)\n+\n+Assign the *Viewer* and *Security Reviewer* roles to the GCP service account at the organization, folder, or project levels to grant Permissions management read access to your GCP environment. \n+\n+During this step, you have the option to **Enable** controller mode by assigning the *Role Administrator* and *Security Administrator* roles to the GCP service account at the organization, folder, or project levels. \n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> The Permissions Management default scope is at the project level. \n+\n+To onboard your GCP environment and configure data collection, see [Onboard a GCP project](onboard-gcp.md).\n+\n+## Summary\n+\n+Congratulations! You have finished configuring data collection for your environment(s), and the data collection process has begun. The data collection process takes some time; approximately 4-5 hours in most cases. The time frame depends on the amount of authorization systems you've onboarded and how much data is available for collection.  \n+\n+The status column in your Permissions Management UI shows you which step of data collection you're at.  \n+\n+ \n+- **Pending**: Permissions Management has not started detecting or onboarding yet. \n+- **Discovering**: Permissions Management is detecting the authorization systems. \n+- **In progress**: Permissions Management has finished detecting the authorization systems and is onboarding. \n+- **Onboarded**: Data collection is complete, and all detected authorization systems are onboarded to Permissions Management. \n+\n+> [!NOTE] \n+> While the data collection process continues, you can begin setting up [users and groups in Permissions Management](how-to-add-remove-user-to-group.md). \n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- [Enable or disable the controller after onboarding](onboard-enable-controller-after-onboarding.md)\n+- [Add an account/subscription/project after onboarding is complete](onboard-add-account-after-onboarding.md)\n+- [Create folders to organize your authorization systems](how-to-create-folders.md)\n+\n+References:\n+- [Permissions Management Glossary](multi-cloud-glossary.md)\n+- [Permissions Management FAQs](faqs.md)"
  },

    "sha": "5018e920b05f7231f285911aa5cb567d51db06a1",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-account-explorer.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 79,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 79,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-account-explorer.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-account-explorer.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-account-explorer.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,79 @@\n+---\n+title: View roles and identities that can access account information from an external account\n+description: How to view information about identities that can access accounts from an external account in Permissions Management.\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management \n+\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# View roles and identities that can access account information from an external account\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+You can view information about users, groups, and resources that can access account information from an external account in Permissions Management.\n+\n+## Display information about users, groups, or tasks\n+\n+1. In Permissions Management, select the **Usage analytics** tab, and then, from the dropdown, select one of the following:\n+\n+   - **Users**\n+   - **Group**\n+   - **Active resources**\n+   - **Active tasks**\n+   - **Active resources**\n+   - **Serverless functions**\n+\n+1. To choose an account from your authorization system, select the lock icon in the left panel.\n+1. In the **Authorization systems** pane, select an account, then select **Apply**.\n+1. To choose a user, role, or group, select the person icon.\n+1. Select a user or group, then select **Apply**.\n+1. To choose an account from your authorization system, select it from the Authorization Systems menu.\n+1. In the user type filter, user, role, or group.\n+1. In the **Task** filter, select **All** or **High-risk tasks**, then select **Apply**.\n+1. To delete a task, select **Delete**, then select **Apply**.\n+\n+## Export information about users, groups, or tasks\n+\n+To export the data in comma-separated values (CSV) file format, select **Export** from the top-right hand corner of the table.\n+\n+## View users and roles\n+1. To view users and roles, select the lock icon, and then select the person icon to open the **Users** pane.\n+1. To view the **Role summary**, select the \"eye\" icon to the right of the role name.\n+\n+   The following details display:\n+   - **Policies**: A list of all the policies attached to the role.\n+   - **Trusted entities**: The identities from external accounts that can assume this role.\n+\n+1. To view all the identities from various accounts that can assume this role, select the down arrow to the left of the role name.\n+1. To view a graph of all the identities that can access the specified account and through which role(s), select the role name.\n+\n+   If Permissions Management is monitoring the external account, it lists specific identities from the accounts that can assume this role. Otherwise, it lists the identities declared in the **Trusted entity** section.\n+\n+   **Connecting roles**: Lists the following roles for each account:\n+      - *Direct roles* that are trusted by the account role.\n+      - *Intermediary roles* that aren't directly trusted by the account role but are assumable by identities through role-chaining.\n+\n+1. To view all the roles from that account that are used to access the specified account, select the down arrow to the left of the account name.\n+1. To view the trusted identities declared by the role, select the down arrow to the left of the role name.\n+\n+   The trusted identities for the role are listed only if the account is being monitored by Permissions Management.\n+\n+1. To view the role definition, select the \"eye\" icon to the right of the role name.\n+\n+   When you select the down arrow and expand details, a search box is displayed. Enter your criteria in this box to search for specific roles.\n+\n+   **Identities with access**: Lists the identities that come from external accounts:\n+      - To view all the identities from that account can access the specified account, select the down arrow to the left of the account name.\n+      - To view the **Role summary** for EC2 instances and Lambda functions, select the \"eye\" icon to the right of the identity name.\n+      - To view a graph of how the identity can access the specified account and through which role(s), select the identity name.\n+\n+1. The **Dashboard** tab displays the **Permissions Creep Index (PCI)** and **Identity findings** information about the account.\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+For more information about the **Permissions Creep Index (PCI)** and SCP information, see [View key statistics and data about your authorization system](ui-dashboard.md)."
  },

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-account-settings.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@\n+---\n+title: View personal and organization information in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n+description: How to view personal and organization information in the Account settings dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management \n+\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# View personal and organization information\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+The **Account settings** dashboard in Permissions Management allows you to view personal information, passwords, and account preferences.\n+This information can't be modified because the user information is pulled from Microsoft Entra-only **User Session Time(min)**.\n+\n+## View personal information\n+\n+- From the Permissions Management home page, select the down arrow to the right of the **User** (your initials) menu, then select **Account Settings**.\n+\n+    The **Personal Information** box displays your **First Name**, **Last Name**, and the **Email Address** used to register your account with Permissions Management.\n+\n+## View current organization information\n+\n+1. From the Permissions Management home page, select the down arrow to the right of the **User** (your initials) menu, then select **Account Settings**.\n+\n+    The **Current Organization Information** displays the **Name** of your organization, the **Tenant ID** box, and the **User Session Timeout (min)**.\n+\n+1. To change duration of the **User Session Timeout (min)**, select **Edit** (the pencil icon), then enter the number of minutes before you want a user session to time out.\n+1. Select the checkmark to confirm your new setting.\n+\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- For information about how to manage user information, see [Manage users and groups with the User management dashboard](ui-user-management.md).\n+- For information about how to view information about active and completed tasks, see [View information about active and completed tasks](ui-tasks.md).\n+- For information about how to select group-based permissions settings, see [Select group-based permissions settings](how-to-create-group-based-permissions.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "0d017a27f4dc452a6dbd2b501b176facae6a0eb7",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-audit-trail.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 398,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 398,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-audit-trail.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-audit-trail.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-audit-trail.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,398 @@\n+---\n+title: Filter and query user activity in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n+description: How to filter and query user activity in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# Filter and query user activity\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+The **Audit** dashboard in Permissions Management details all user activity performed in your authorization system. It captures all high risk activity in a centralized location, and allows system administrators to query the logs. The **Audit** dashboard enables you to:\n+\n+- Create and save new queries so you can access key data points easily.\n+- Query across multiple authorization systems in one query.\n+\n+## Filter information by authorization system\n+\n+If you haven't used filters before, the default filter is the first authorization system in the filter list.\n+\n+If you have used filters before, the default filter is last filter you selected.\n+\n+1. To display the **Audit** dashboard, on the Permissions Management home page, select **Audit**.\n+\n+1. To select your authorization system type, in the **Authorization System Type** box, select Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft Azure (**Azure**), Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**), or Platform (**Platform**).\n+\n+1. To select your authorization system, in the **Authorization System** box:\n+\n+    - From the **List** subtab, select the accounts you want to use.\n+    - From the **Folders** subtab, select the folders you want to use.\n+\n+1. To view your query results, select **Apply**.\n+\n+## Create, view, modify, or delete a query\n+\n+There are several different query parameters you can configure individually or in combination. The query parameters and corresponding instructions are listed in the following sections.\n+\n+- To create a new query, select **New Query**.\n+- To view an existing query, select **View** (the eye icon).\n+- To edit an existing query, select **Edit** (the pencil icon).\n+- To delete a function line in a query, select **Delete** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+- To create multiple queries at one time, select **Add New Tab** to the right of the **Query** tabs that are displayed.\n+\n+  You can open a maximum number of six query tab pages at the same time. A message appears when you've reached the maximum.\n+\n+## Create a query with specific parameters\n+\n+### Create a query with a date\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, the default parameter displayed is **Date In \"Last day\"**.\n+\n+    The first-line parameter always defaults to **Date** and can't be deleted.\n+\n+1. To edit date details, select **Edit** (the pencil icon).\n+\n+    To view query details, select **View** (the eye icon).\n+\n+1. Select **Operator**, and then select an option:\n+    - **In**: Select this option to set a time range from the past day to the past year.\n+    - **Is**: Select this option to choose a specific date from the calendar.\n+    - **Custom**: Select this option to set a date range from the **From** and **To** calendars.\n+\n+1. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+1. To save your query, select **Save**.\n+\n+    To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### View operator options for identities\n+\n+The **Operator** menu displays the following options depending on the identity you select in the first dropdown:\n+\n+- **Is** / **Is Not**: View a list of all available usernames. You can either select or enter a username in the box.\n+- **Contains** / **Not Contains**: Enter text that the **Username** should or shouldn't contain, for example, *Permissions Management*.\n+- **In** / **Not In**: View a list all available usernames and select multiple usernames.\n+\n+### Create a query with a username\n+\n+1. In the **New query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. From the menu, select **Username**.\n+\n+1. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+1. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+    You can change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** with the username **Test**.\n+\n+1. Select the plus (**+**) sign, select **Or** with **Contains**, and then enter a username, for example, *Permissions Management*.\n+\n+1. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+1. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+1. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a resource name\n+\n+1. In the **New query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. From the menu, select **Resource Name**.\n+\n+1. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+1. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+      You can change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** with resource name **Test**.\n+\n+1. Select the plus (**+**) sign, select **Or** with **Contains**, and then enter a username, for example, *Permissions Management*.\n+\n+1. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+1. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+1. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a resource type\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. From the menu, select **Resource Type**.\n+\n+1. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+1. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** with resource type **s3::bucket**.\n+\n+1. Select the plus (**+**) sign, select **Or** with **Is**, and then enter or select  `ec2::instance`.\n+\n+1. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+1. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+1. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+\n+### Create a query with a task name\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. From the menu, select **Task Name**.\n+\n+1. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+1. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** with task name **s3:CreateBucket**.\n+\n+1. Select **Add**, select **Or**  with **Is**, and then enter or select `ec2:TerminateInstance`.\n+\n+1. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+1. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+1. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a state\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. From the menu, select **State**.\n+\n+1. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+    - **Is** / **Is not**: Allows a user to select in the value field and select **Authorization Failure**, **Error**, or **Success**.\n+\n+1. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+1. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** with State **Authorization Failure**.\n+\n+1. Select the **Add** icon, select **Or** with **Is**, and then select **Success**.\n+\n+1. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+1. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+1. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a role name\n+\n+1. In the **New query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+2. From the menu, select **Role Name**.\n+\n+3. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+4. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+5. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Contains** with free text **Test**.\n+\n+6. Select the **Add** icon, select **Or** with **Contains**, and then enter your criteria, for example *Permissions Management*.\n+\n+7. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+8. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+9. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a role session name\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+2. From the menu, select **Role Session Name**.\n+\n+3. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+4. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+5. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Contains** with free text **Test**.\n+\n+6. Select the **Add** icon, select **Or** with **Contains**, and then enter your criteria, for example *Permissions Management*.\n+\n+7. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+8. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+9. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with an access key ID\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+2. From the menu, select **Access Key ID**.\n+\n+3. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+4. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+5. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Contains** with free `AKIAIFXNDW2Z2MPEH5OQ`.\n+\n+6. Select the **Add** icon, select **Or** with **Not** **Contains**, and then enter `AKIAVP2T3XG7JUZRM7WU`.\n+\n+7. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+8. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+9. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a tag key\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+2. From the menu, select **Tag Key**.\n+\n+3. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+4. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+5. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** and type in, or select **Test**.\n+\n+6. Select the **Add** icon, select **Or** with **Is**, and then enter your criteria, for example *Permissions Management*.\n+\n+7. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+8. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+9. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### Create a query with a tag key value\n+\n+1. In the **New Query** section, select **Add**.\n+\n+2. From the menu, select **Tag Key Value**.\n+\n+3. From the **Operator** menu, select the required option.\n+\n+4. To add criteria to this section, select **Add**.\n+\n+5. Change the operation between **And** / **Or** statements, and select other criteria. For example, the first set of criteria selected can be **Is** and type in, or select **Test**.\n+\n+6. Select the **Add** icon, select **Or** with **Is**, and then enter your criteria, for example *Permissions Management*.\n+\n+7. To remove a row of criteria, select **Remove** (the minus sign **-** icon).\n+\n+8. To run the query on the current selection, select **Search**.\n+\n+9. To clear the recent selections, select **Reset**.\n+\n+### View query results\n+\n+1. In the **Activity** table, your query results display in columns.\n+\n+     The results display all executed tasks that aren't read-only.\n+\n+1. To sort each column by ascending or descending value, select the up or down arrows next to the column name.\n+\n+    - **Identity Details**: The name of the identity, for example the name of the role session performing the task.\n+\n+        - To view the **Raw Events Summary**, which displays the full details of the event, next to the **Name** column, select **View**.\n+\n+    - **Resource Name**: The name of the resource on which the task is being performed.\n+\n+        If the column displays **Multiple**, it means multiple resources are listed in the column.\n+\n+1. To view a list of all resources, hover over **Multiple**.\n+\n+    - **Resource Type**: Displays the type of resource, for example, *Key* (encryption key) or *Bucket* (storage).\n+    - **Task Name**: The name of the task performed by the identity.\n+\n+         An exclamation mark (**!**) next to the task name indicates that the task failed.\n+\n+    - **Date**: The date when the task was performed.\n+\n+    - **IP Address**: The IP address from where the user performed the task.\n+\n+    - **Authorization System**: The authorization system name in which the task was performed.\n+\n+1. To download the results in comma-separated values (CSV) file format, select **Download**.\n+\n+## Save a query\n+\n+1. After you complete your query selections from the **New Query** section, select **Save**.\n+\n+2. In the **Query Name** box, enter a name for your query, and then select **Save**.\n+\n+3. To save a query with a different name, select the ellipses (**...**) next to **Save**, and then select **Save As**.\n+\n+4. Make your query selections from the **New Query** section, select the ellipses (**...**), and then select **Save As**.\n+\n+5. To save a new query, in the **Save Query** box, enter the name for the query, and then select **Save**.\n+\n+6. To save an existing query you've modified, select the ellipses (**...**).\n+\n+      - To save a modified query under the same name, select **Save**.\n+      - To save a modified query under a different name, select **Save As**.\n+\n+### View a saved query\n+\n+1. Select **Saved Queries**, and then select a query from the **Load Queries** list.\n+\n+      A message box opens with the following options: **Load with the saved authorization system** or **Load with the currently selected authorization system**.\n+\n+1. Select the appropriate option, and then select **Load Queries**.\n+\n+1. View the query information:\n+\n+      - **Query Name**: Displays the name of the saved query.\n+      - **Query Type**: Displays whether the query is a *System* query or a *Custom* query.\n+      - **Schedule**: Displays how often a report is generated. You can schedule a one-time report or a monthly report.\n+      - **Next On**: Displays the date and time the next report will be generated.\n+      - **Format**: Displays the output format for the report, for example, CSV.\n+      - **Last Modified On**: Displays the date in which the query was last modified on.\n+\n+1. To view or set schedule details, select the gear icon, select **Create Schedule**, and then set the details.\n+\n+   If a schedule has already been created, select the gear icon to open the **Edit Schedule** box.\n+\n+      - **Repeat**: Sets how often the report should repeat.\n+      - **Start On**: Sets the date when you want to receive the report.\n+      - **At**: Sets the specific time when you want to receive the report.\n+      - **Report Format**: Select the output type for the file, for example, CSV.\n+      - **Share Report With**: The email address of the user who is creating the schedule is displayed in this field. You can add other email addresses.\n+\n+1. After selecting your options, select **Schedule**.\n+\n+\n+### Save a query under a different name\n+\n+- Select the ellipses (**...**).\n+\n+    System queries have only one option:\n+\n+    - **Duplicate**: Creates a duplicate of the query and names the file *Copy of XXX*.\n+\n+    Custom queries have the following options:\n+\n+    - **Rename**: Enter the new name of the query and select **Save**.\n+    - **Delete**: Delete the saved query.\n+\n+        The **Delete Query** box opens, asking you to confirm that you want to delete the query. Select **Yes** or **No**.\n+\n+    - **Duplicate**: Creates a duplicate of the query and names it *Copy of XXX*.\n+    - **Delete Schedule**: Deletes the schedule details for this query.\n+\n+        This option isn't available if you haven't yet saved a schedule.\n+\n+        The **Delete Schedule** box opens, asking you to confirm that you want to delete the schedule. Select **Yes** or **No**.\n+\n+\n+## Export the results of a query as a report\n+\n+- To export the results of the query, select **Export**.\n+\n+    Permissions Management exports the results in comma-separated values (**CSV**) format, portable document format (**PDF**), or Microsoft Excel Open XML Spreadsheet (**XLSX**) format.\n+\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- For information on how to view how users access information, see [Use queries to see how users access information](ui-audit-trail.md).\n+- For information on how to create a query, see [Create a custom query](how-to-create-custom-queries.md).\n+- For information on how to generate an on-demand report from a query, see [Generate an on-demand report from a query](how-to-audit-trail-results.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "ca41f6454650f12efc5337cc500592572267f501",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-dashboard.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 80,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 80,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-dashboard.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-dashboard.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-dashboard.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@\n+---\n+title: View data about the activity in your authorization system\n+description: How to view data about the activity in your authorization system in the Microsoft Entra Permissions Management Dashboard.\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# View data about the activity in your authorization system\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+The Permissions Management **Dashboard** provides an overview of the authorization system and account activity being monitored. Use this dashboard to view data collected from your Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) authorization systems.\n+\n+## View data about your authorization system\n+\n+1. From the Permissions Management home page, select **Dashboard**.\n+1. From the **Authorization systems type** dropdown, select **AWS**, **Azure**, or **GCP**.\n+1. Select the **Authorization System** box to display a **List** of accounts and **Folders** available to you.\n+1. Select the accounts and folders you want, and then select **Apply**.\n+\n+   The **Permission Creep Index (PCI)** chart updates to display information about the accounts and folders you selected. The number of days since the information was last updated displays in the upper right corner.\n+\n+   >[!NOTE]\n+   >Default and GCP-managed service accounts are not included in the PCI calculation.\n+\n+1. In the Permission Creep Index (PCI) graph, select a bubble.\n+\n+    The bubble displays the number of identities that are considered high-risk.\n+\n+    *High-risk* refers to the number of users who have permissions that exceed their normal or required usage.\n+\n+1. Select the box to display detailed information about the identities contributing to the **Low PCI**, **Medium PCI**, and **High PCI**.\n+\n+1. The **Highest PCI change** displays the authorization system name with the PCI number and the change number for the last seven days, if applicable.\n+\n+    - To view all the changes and PCI ratings in your authorization system, select **View all**.\n+\n+1. To return to the PCI graph, select the **Graph** icon in the upper right of the list box.\n+\n+For more information about the Permissions Management **Dashboard**, see [View key statistics and data about your authorization system](ui-dashboard.md).\n+\n+## View user data on the PCI heat map\n+\n+The **Permission Creep Index (PCI)** heat map shows the incurred risk of users with access to high-risk privileges. The distribution graph displays all the users who contribute to the privilege creep. It displays how many users contribute to a particular score. For example, if the score from the PCI chart is 14, the graph shows how many users have a score of 14.\n+\n+- To view detailed data about a user, select the number.\n+\n+    The PCI trend graph shows you the historical trend of the PCI score over the last 90 days.\n+\n+- To download the **PCI History** report, select **Download** (the down arrow icon).\n+\n+\n+## View information about users, roles, resources, and PCI trends\n+\n+To view specific information about the following, select the number displayed on the heat map.\n+\n+- **Users**: Displays the total number of users and how many fall into the high, medium, and low categories.\n+- **Roles**: Displays the total number of roles and how many fall into the high, medium, and low categories.\n+- **Resources**: Displays the total number of resources and how many fall into the high, medium, and low categories.\n+- **PCI trend**: Displays a line graph of the PCI trend over the last several weeks.\n+\n+## View identity findings\n+\n+The **Identity** section below the heat map on the left side of the page shows all the relevant findings about identities, including roles that can access secret information, roles that are inactive, over provisioned active roles, and so on.\n+\n+- To expand the full list of identity findings, select **All findings**.\n+\n+## View resource findings\n+\n+The **Resource** section below the heat map on the right side of the page shows all the relevant findings about your resources. It includes unencrypted S3 buckets, open security groups, managed keys, and so on.\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- For more information about how to view key statistics and data in the Dashboard, see [View key statistics and data about your authorization system](ui-dashboard.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "759ed8db4e60bb651ae231b2cd5c27c3a4a9b063",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-data-billable-resources.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 43,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 43,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-data-billable-resources.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-data-billable-resources.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-data-billable-resources.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@\n+---\n+title: View current billable resources in your authorization systems\n+description: How to view current billable resources in your authorization system in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# View billable resources listed in your authorization system\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+Gain insight into current billable resources listed in your authorization system. In Microsoft Entra Permissions Management, a billable resource is defined as a cloud service that uses compute or memory and requires a license. The Permissions Management Billable Resources tab shows you which resources are in your authorization system, and how many of them you're being billed for.\n+\n+Here's the current list of resources per cloud provider. This list is subject to change as cloud providers add more services in the future.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/onboard-enable-tenant/billable-resources.png\" alt-text=\"A table of current Microsoft billable resources.\" lightbox=\"media/onboard-enable-tenant/billable-resources.png\":::\n+\n+## View resources in your authorization system\n+\n+1. To access your billable resource information, from the Permissions Management home page, select Settings (gear icon).\n+1. Select the Billable Resources tab.\n+1. Select your Authorization System:\n+\n+    - **AWS** for Amazon Web Services.\n+    - **Azure** for Microsoft Azure.\n+    - **GCP** for Google Cloud Platform.\n+\n+    The interface displays information showing which resource you have in your Authorization System per category.\n+\n+1. To change the columns displayed in the table, select **Columns**, and then select the information you want to display.\n+\n+    - To discard your changes, select **Reset to default**.\n+\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- For information about viewing and configuring settings for collecting data from your authorization system and its associated accounts, see [View and configure settings for data collection](product-data-sources.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "71a90e3cfa4865631368284e87c2e7c134638e89",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-data-sources.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 103,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 103,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-data-sources.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-data-sources.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-data-sources.md?ref=fb74d47ded7bba616bb6ab5256a7eb80eaf74273",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,103 @@\n+---\n+title: View and configure settings for data collection\n+description: How to view and configure settings for collecting data from your authorization system.\n+author: jenniferf-skc\n+manager: pmwongera\n+ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n+\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 04/01/2025\n+ms.author: jfields\n+---\n+\n+# View and configure settings for data collection\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on October 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n+\n+You can use the **Data Collectors** dashboard in Permissions Management to view and configure settings for collecting data from your authorization systems. It also provides information about the status of the data collection.\n+\n+## Access and view data sources\n+\n+1. To access your data sources, in the Permissions Management home page, select **Settings** (the gear icon). Then select the **Data Collectors** tab.\n+\n+1. On the **Data Collectors** dashboard, select your authorization system type:\n+\n+    - **AWS** for Amazon Web Services.\n+    - **Azure** for Microsoft Azure.\n+    - **GCP** for Google Cloud Platform.\n+\n+1. To display specific information about an account:\n+\n+    1. Enter the following information:\n+\n+        - **Uploaded on**: Select **All** accounts, **Online** accounts, or **Offline** accounts.\n+        - **Transformed on**: Select **All** accounts, **Online** accounts, or **Offline** accounts.\n+        - **Search**: Enter an ID or Internet Protocol (IP) address to find a specific account.\n+\n+    1. Select **Apply** to display the results.\n+\n+        Select **Reset Filter** to discard your settings.\n+\n+1. The following information displays:\n+\n+    - **ID**: The unique identification number for the data collector.\n+    - **Data types**: Displays the data types that are collected:\n+         - **Entitlements**: The permissions of all identities and resources for all the configured authorization systems.\n+    - **Recently uploaded on**: Displays whether the entitlement data is being collected.\n+\n+        The status displays *ONLINE* if the data collection has no errors and *OFFLINE* if there are errors.\n+    - **Recently transformed on**: Displays whether the entitlement data is being processed.\n+\n+        The status displays *ONLINE* if the data processing has no errors and *OFFLINE* if there are errors.\n+    - The **Tenant ID**.\n+    - The **Tenant name**.\n+\n+## Modify a data collector\n+\n+1. Select the ellipses **(...)** at the end of the row in the table.\n+1. Select **Edit Configuration**.\n+\n+    The **Permissions Management Onboarding - Summary** box displays.\n+\n+1. Select **Edit** (the pencil icon) for each field you want to change.\n+1. Select **Verify now & save**.\n+\n+    To verify your changes later, select **Save & verify later**.\n+\n+    When your changes are saved, the following message displays: **Successfully updated configuration.**\n+\n+## Delete a data collector\n+\n+1. Select the ellipses **(...)** at the end of the row in the table.\n+1. Select **Delete Configuration**.\n+\n+    The **Permissions Management Onboarding - Summary** box displays.\n+1. Select **Delete**.\n+1. Check your email for a one time password (OTP) code, and enter it in **Enter OTP**.\n+\n+    If you don't receive an OTP, select **Resend OTP**.\n+\n+    The following message displays: **Successfully deleted configuration.**\n+\n+## Start collecting data from an authorization system\n+\n+1. Select the **Authorization Systems** tab, and then select your authorization system type.\n+1. Select the ellipses **(...)** at the end of the row in the table.\n+1. Select **Collect Data**.\n+\n+    A message displays to confirm data collection has started.\n+\n+## Stop collecting data from an authorization system\n+\n+1. Select the ellipses **(...)** at the end of the row in the table.\n+1. To delete your authorization system, select **Delete**.\n+\n+    The **Validate OTP To Delete Authorization System** box displays.\n+\n+1. Enter the OTP code\n+1. Select **Verify**.\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- To view an inventory of created resources and licensing information for your authorization system, see [Display an inventory of  created resources and licenses for your authorization system](./product-data-billable-resources.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "cb7d566f9c9d14b5e94ac2e73421f427fee0c7fe",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-define-permission-levels.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 273,
